name: emaciation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the state of being very thin and weak, usually because of illness or extreme hunger: In spite of the fact that the patient eats well, the disease causes emaciation. Chronic wasting disease in cattle causes severe emaciation and eventually death. See
emaciated
More examplesFewer examplesSymptoms include emaciation and listlessness. The image brings to mind the emaciation of refugees in a camp. The ghastly emaciation of these children is horrible.
